title: Greece crisis: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: greek parliament approves bailout offer after marathon discussions .
a number of pro-government lawmakers vote 'no ' .
prime minister alexis tsipras wins vote with support of opposition mps .
imf says greek debt is 'highly unsustainable ' .

text: this brings to an end our live coverage of yet another dramatic day of the ongoing greek financial crisis .
thanks for staying with us !
you can still get all the latest developments
so , 229 greek mps backed the reforms , while 64 voted against .
however , more than 30 mps from mr tsipras ' syriza party voted `` no '' .
the `` yes '' vote was a prerequisite for tough bailout negotiations to begin .

documents.title: tsipras ' plea
text: greek prime minister alexis tsipras is addressing parliament now .
he says `` we are called on to take a decision with responsibility '' , according to reuters .

text: meanwhile , protesters on the streets of athens set on fire cars , cash machines and anything else they were able to find .

documents.title: speaker walks out
text: greek parliamentary speaker zoe constantopoulo , a vocal opponent of the deal , has walked out and refused to take part in the rest of the debate , says dimitrios syrrakos , a eurozone expert at manchester metropolitan university .
he tells bbc 5live it is the first time he has seen anything like this in 25 years of covering greek politics .

documents.title: fire bombs in athens
text: riot police officers run away from fire bombs thrown by anti-austerity protesters during clashes in athens .

as greek lawmakers prepared to vote on the unpopular deal , police fired tear gas to push back dozens of hooded and masked protesters , who threw rocks and stones as they chanted angrily in syntagma square , afp reported .

documents.title: tough talks
text: parliaments in several member states still have to give the green light to the debt agreement , afp reports .
germany , the eu powerhouse , is set to vote on the plan on friday .
however , tough talks to finalise the bailout - expected to take much of the summer - will only begin after that .

if a deal is reached , eurozone governments will contribute between €40bn and €50bn , the imf will contribute another portion and the rest will come from selling off state assets and from financial markets , a european official quoted by afp said .

documents.title: treasury confirms it 's seeking to keep uk out of greek bailout
text: the uk government is hoping to secure a deal with the european commission that would significantly strengthen the 2010 agreement to keep britain out of any greek bailout , the bbc 's deputy political editor james landale has reported .
`` we recognise greece has an urgent need for temporary financing over the next few weeks before the latest eurozone funding is in place and we will seek to be constructive if we can .
`` but as the chancellor has said throughout , we are immovable on the principle that british taxpayers ' cash should not and will not be on the line in any eurozone bailout .
`` it is because we have refused to compromise on our principles that the commission is now proposing ways to specifically ring-fence us from any risk .
as far as we are concerned this is a red line and we think that message is now being heard and understood , '' a treasury spokesperson said .

documents.title: eurogroup discussion set for thursday morning
text: eurogroup ministers have confirmed that they will hold a teleconference at 09:00 bst on thursday to discuss a third greek bailout , eurogroup head and dutch finance minister jeroen dijsselbloem has confirmed .

documents.title: imf director says she 'has hope '
text: greece 's eu creditors are moving closer to the idea of restructuring its debt , imf director christine lagarde said .

`` i have some hope , because as late as a couple of hours ago , i understand that there were some more positive noises towards that principle of debt restructuring , '' she told cnn international in an interview .
the imf has indicated it can not take part in a third bailout for greece unless its debt structure is restructured . ''
she suggested extending the debt repayment period was the most likely option .

documents.title: opposition party reiterates support for alexis tsipras
text: the head of centrist to potami party , which has already said that it will support prime minister alex tsipras , is currently addressing parliament .
he reiterates his support the fact that it plans to remain an opposition party and will not join a future coalition government .
`` we will back the government on a deal even though a much better one could have been achieved , '' says stavros theodorakis .

documents.title: 'most of the demonstrators are peaceful'via email
text: a biz live reader stephen hance on the scene emails in to let us know that most of the demonstrations are in fact peaceful :
`` in plaka district of athens watching demo go by - most peaceful but then fires on the road and a group of masked youths took rocks to the alpha bank near acropolis museum .
we have photos of demo - but left when the rocks came out . ''

documents.title: germany dismisses 'human rights ' fears
text: germany has dismissed concerns that its stance on greece could see it accused of ignoring human rights .
german finance ministry spokesman martin jaeger said he could n't see evidence of human rights being ignored by berlin .
it comes after an independent un expert on foreign debt warned that greece 's creditors may break international law if the austerity reforms imposed on greece lead to undue hardship .

documents.title: greek finance minister : 'we had no choice '
text: new greek finance minister euclid tsakalotos is currently speaking in the debate .
he admits he does n't know if it did the right thing agreeing to the reforms .
`` monday was most difficult day of my life .
it 's a decision that will weigh on me for rest of my life .
we had no choice , '' he says ,
`` we never said this was a good agreement , '' he adds .

documents.title: clashes as thousands of people protest outside parliament
text: around 12,500 people are believed to be at the anti-austerity rally at syntagma square outside athens .
clashes between protestors and police have broken out just as greek mps begin to debate the reforms which will be voted on later .
journalists on the scene say riot police have used pepper spray and tear gas to fight back youths in the crowd who were hurling molotov cocktails and rocks at police .

documents.title: why greece 's crisis is the imf 's crisis too
text: jamie robertson reports on how the imf tweaked its own rules in order to lend to greece five years ago , and lived to regret it .
back then it agreed to lay aside the question of whether the country 's debts were sustainable .
now `` sustainability '' is all it can talk about .
in the meantime its credibility as the world 's most respected international lender has been badly damaged .

documents.title: greek pm makes fresh plea for support
text: `` if i wo n't have your support it will be hard for me to remain as pm , '' greek prime minister alexis tsipras has just said .
it 's still uncertain how many mps from the ruling left wing syriza party will back mr tsipras , with government estimates suggesting between 30 and 40 will oppose the measures .
observers have suggested if the rebellion is this large it may force mr tsipras to call a fresh election .

documents.title: french mps say 'oui '
text: the french government has overwhelmingly backed the greek debt deal .
the lower house national assembly backed the agreement by 412 votes to 69 .
prime minister manuel valls said the deal was the only route out of the crisis .
`` we are demanding a lot of the greeks , not just to punish it , but to accompany it through a vital economic recovery . ''
he said .

documents.title: what greece 's former finance minister thinks of the agreement
text: former finance minister yanis varoufakis has been busy , adding his thoughts in red to the official

documents.title: key meeting thursday at 10:00
text: thursday at 10:00 is the next key hurdle after wednesday 's parliamentary vote .
it 's when the eurogroup meets to decide whether or not greece has met the required commitments .
it 's only then that talks over a third bailout as well as `` bridge '' or temporary financing can officially begin .

documents.title: hard choices
text: the leader of a far-left faction within greece 's governing syriza party , energy minister panagiotis lafazanis is also among the most prominent critics of the economic measures ordered by the eu .

`` the choice between a bailout or catastrophe is a choice made in the face of terror , '' he says , echoing the language of former greek finance minister yanis varoufakis , who has accused greece 's creditors of `` terrorism '' .
mr varoufakis , standing in the below , and mr lafazanis , seated , had a chat in parliament on wednesday .

documents.title: giving greeks a free ride
text: a worker at a paris metro station paid for harris mylonas 's ticket - because he is greek .
in the journal ,
`` it is besides the point that i did not personally need this form of solidarity .
it was also of little matter that many of my compatriots would find this story depressing .
what resonated in the moment was that this exchange was exactly what the founders of the european union envisaged : a solidary group of european citizens living in peace and prosperity . ''
mr mylonas warns that the eu 's leaders are losing sight of this solidarity in their dealings with greece .
and in doing so , he says , they are inadvertently strengthening euro-sceptics and - ultimately - weakening the union .

documents.title: boycott calls
text: anger at the conditions attached to the latest greek bailout has translated into a call for action .
activists are pushing for a boycott of german goods , with the # boycottgermany hashtag now having been used more than 30,000 times .

documents.title: negotiating stance
text: as the greek parliament discusses the economic measures demanded by the eu , the body language of greek finance minister euclid tsakalatos tells a story of its own .

documents.title: love thy neighbourvia email
text: the uk government helped the irish republic financial assistance during it 's financial crisis , despite the fact that ireland is part of the eurozone and the uk is not - so why not help greece ?
author: Philip Baker
Live page reader

documents.title: greek debate continues
text: there have been angry exchanges in the greek parliament as mps discuss the eurozone 's reform demands .

the former finance minister , yanis varoufakis , was heckled in a parliamentary committee when he compared the proposed deal to the versailles treaty that penalised defeated germany at the end of the first world war .

documents.title: cameron : uk 'not part ' of greek rescue
text: david cameron insists the uk will not contribute to emergency eu funding for greece , telling mps that it is a matter for the eurozone .

documents.title: greek deputy finance minister resigns
text: greece 's deputy finance minister nadia valavani has resigned ahead of a vote in parliament on whether to agree a bailout from eurozone creditors .
`` i 'm not going to vote for this amendment and this means i can not stay in the government , '' ms valavani told reporters .
she submitted her resignation in a letter to prime minister alexis tsipras .

documents.title: imf 'lost control of own arrangement '
text: `` it shows how little influence the imf has on programme negotiations , '' says ousmene mandeng , a german economist and former senior imf official on bbc world tv .
`` the imf has lost control of its own arrangement and therefore is now trying , through the back door , trying to influence proceedings . ''
`` germany has clearly become the chief negotiator '' and so is responsible for the `` poor outcome '' , he said .

documents.title: more on the eu funding plan for greecevia email
text: more from the bbc 's chris morris on that proposal to use the efsm fund : ``
`` there are , officials say , 'different options for collateralisation being explored . '
in other words there may be a way of using the efsm but at the same time making sure that countries like britain do n't have to put up part of the guarantee .
a decision to use the efsm needs a qualified majority of member states to vote in favour - so britain could be outvoted if it seeks to block this proposal . ''
author: Chris Morris
BBC Europe Correspondent
